column4: Hi all, has anyone successfully burnt ubuntu 9.10 desktop I keep having "errors found on 2 files" after a disk check run
yep.  Burnt lots of copies of it.  Are you sure you have an error-free iso?  Consider using torrent to download instead as that will guarantee it's error free
my last attempt was with a torrent client kget but I ended up with the same result, i'm going through my 4th wasted cd :(
step 2: consider using cd-rw then, not cd-rs
also, consider installing to a USB key instead
I believe there's a utility in 9.04 called USB Creator.
it also may be an issue that you're burning too fast for the media.  try burning at a slower speed, like 4x.
hoonteke: tx, could be as well the burning speed
oh, thanks.  yeesh, spell it out.  :-P
hoonteke: I am using a an cd drive emulator when on Xp to test the iso, and it loads ton of error msg

you're using winxp to test the ISO?  The CD can actually test itself.  Try to boot the current machine with the CD you just burned.  The very first menu you get will give you the option to "Check CD for defects"
that will tell you more definitively if youv'e errors, than any emulator in Windows.
why are you using a drive emulator to begin with?  If you're trying to do a virtual install or test, just use virtual box.
no I am using both ways, with a drive emulator sometimes and always with self - testing prgm from the cd and both come up with errors
alright, so you've burn errors.  well, make sure you have a good ISO: boot with it inside of VirtualBox.
you also might try a different burning program: http://infrarecorder.org/
alright, gonna try that, tx for your help
